column1:
4.5.6	
Pharmacological management
4.5.6.1	
Alpha-adrenergic blockers
Alpha-adrenergic blockers are postulated to relieve LUTS caused by BOO in women via smooth muscle 
relaxation in the bladder neck, thus decreasing bladder outlet resistance [542].

Offer pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT) aimed at pelvic floor muscle relaxation to women 
with functional bladder outlet obstruction (BOO).

Prioritise research that investigates and advances understanding of the mechanisms and 
impact of PFMT on the coordinated relaxation of the pelvic floor during voiding.

Offer the use of a vaginal pessary to women with grade three or four cystocoeles and BOO 
who are not eligible/inclined towards other treatment options.

Offer urinary containment devices to women with BOO to address urinary leakage as a 
result of BOO, but not as a treatment to correct the condition.

Offer clean intermittent self-dilatation to women with urethral strictures or post-urinary 
incontinence surgery for BOO.
Do not offer an intraurethral device to women with BOO.
